customer_name: Ervin Miller Marcus Miller Anna May Miller
site_name: Ervin Miller Marcus Miller Anna Mary Miller

citations.narrative:
Two enclosures for weaned puppies have flat solid surfaces with compacted soiled bedding mixed with excreta that aren't
getting spot cleaned daily. A daily removal of excreta from solid surfaces is required and helps maintain comfort for dogs
and puppies. Ensure to maintain a routine of daily spot cleaning all hard surfaces that dogs/puppies can contact.
***Correct from 2/18/2025 forward.

Some watering bowls were empty at time of inspection. The licensee provided water to affected dogs and they did not
appear thirsty and did not drink much, however all dogs must have access to potable water continuously unless restricted
by the attending veterinarian. Keeping water available for dogs at all times helps provide for their health and comfort. If
using containers, ensure water containers can maintain potable drinking water available continuously for dogs by
checking and filling them more often and/or securing those water bowls that get tipped.
***Maintain correct by 2/18/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Two enclosures for weaned puppies have flat solid surfaces with compacted soiled bedding mixed with excreta that aren't 
getting spot cleaned daily. A daily removal of excreta from solid surfaces is required and helps maintain comfort for dogs 
and puppies. Ensure to maintain a routine of daily spot cleaning all hard surfaces that dogs/puppies can contact.  
***Correct from 2/18/2025 forward. 
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
Some watering bowls were empty at time of inspection. The licensee provided water to affected dogs and they did not 
appear thirsty and did not drink much, however all dogs must have access to potable water continuously unless restricted 
by the attending veterinarian. Keeping water available for dogs at all times helps provide for their health and comfort. If 
using containers, ensure water containers can maintain potable drinking water available continuously for dogs by 
checking and filling them more often and/or securing those water bowls that get tipped. 
***Maintain correct by 2/18/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
